keyMoments.title: Accepting the Hormone Side Effects
keyMoments.description: Luffy acknowledges Ivankov's warning that the Tension Hormones only mask his injuries but insists on continuing to save Ace regardless of the consequences.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's willingness to sacrifice his health and potentially his life to save his brother.

keyMoments.title: Defeating Koby
keyMoments.description: Luffy easily defeats his friend Koby with a single Gomu Gomu no Bullet, showing the vast difference in their current power levels.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates how far Luffy has progressed since Episode 1 and his single-minded focus on saving Ace.

keyMoments.title: First Clear Manifestation of Conqueror's Haki
keyMoments.description: In a moment of absolute desperation to save Ace, Luffy unconsciously unleashes a massive burst of Conqueror's Haki that knocks out the executioners and numerous Marines and pirates.
keyMoments.significance: This is the first clear and undeniable display of Luffy's Conqueror's Haki, confirming he possesses one of the rarest powers in the world and marking him as having the qualities of a king.

abilities.description: A rare form of Haki that allows the user to exert their willpower over others, knocking out those with weak wills. Luffy uses it unconsciously to stop Ace's execution.
Luffy stretches both arms back then releases them to deliver a double palm strike.

relationships.description: Despite being on opposite sides of the war, Luffy and Koby's friendship from their first meeting remains, though Luffy must defeat him to save Ace.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy and Koby clash at Marineford as Koby tries to stop Luffy from reaching Ace, testing their friendship.

reveals.information: Luffy possesses Conqueror's Haki (Haoshoku Haki), unconsciously using it to knock out the executioners and stop Ace's execution
Luffy's body is severely damaged and only functioning due to Ivankov's Tension Hormones which mask but do not heal his injuries

keyMoments.title: Remembering His Promise
keyMoments.description: Koby recalls the promise he made to Luffy in Episode 1 to become a great Marine, strengthening his resolve to face his friend despite the danger.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Koby's growth and commitment to his dream, paralleling Luffy's own journey.
keyMoments.quote: I made a promise... to become a great Marine!

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Luffy
keyMoments.description: Koby bravely confronts Luffy to uphold his dream of becoming a Marine, but is instantly defeated by a single Gomu Gomu no Bullet attack.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that while Koby has grown stronger, he still has a long way to go to match Luffy's current power level.

relationships.description: Koby and Luffy maintain their friendship despite being on opposite sides at Marineford.

evolutionMoments.description: Koby confronts Luffy at Marineford, testing their bond as they fight on opposite sides of the war.

reveals.information: Koby has grown strong enough and brave enough to face Luffy in battle, upholding his promise to become a great Marine

keyMoments.title: Destroying a Pacifista for Luffy
keyMoments.description: Hancock destroys a Pacifista that was attacking Luffy and Ivankov, openly defying the World Government and betraying her position as a Warlord to protect the man she loves.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the extent of Hancock's love for Luffy and her willingness to sacrifice her position and alliance with the World Government for him.
keyMoments.quote: I do not want the likes of you to say my name!

relationships.description: Hancock's love for Luffy drives her to betray the World Government and destroy Marine weapons to protect him.

evolutionMoments.description: Hancock openly defies the Marines and destroys Pacifistas to protect Luffy, fully committing to his side.

reveals.information: Hancock has completely abandoned her alliance with the World Government and Marines in favor of protecting Luffy

name.japanese: エンポリオ・イワンコフ

keyMoments.title: Warning Luffy About Hormone Side Effects
keyMoments.description: Ivankov warns Luffy that the Tension Hormones only mask his injuries and don't actually heal the damage, expressing concern for Luffy's wellbeing.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the serious risk Luffy is taking and foreshadows future consequences of overusing the hormones.
keyMoments.quote: The energy hormones do not repair the damage you have taken!

keyMoments.title: Recognizing Luffy's Unconscious Haki Use
keyMoments.description: Ivankov observes that Luffy is using Conqueror's Haki unconsciously and comments that he is not yet ready to control this power.
keyMoments.significance: Provides exposition about Luffy's untapped potential and the rarity of Conqueror's Haki.
keyMoments.quote: He is not aware that he is using it... he is not yet ready to use this power.
